Linked issue: close #281
author: loserwang1024

comments.body: @wuchong @luoyuxia , CC

#312 is introducing a compatibility breaking change which requires all the tables to be re-created. So v0.6 is not a compatible version. 

How about making modified_time and created_time required in this PR to simplify the compatible logic? Currently, many code still create `TableInfo` with `-1` createdTime and modifiedTime which is not correct and may introduce future bugs. If they are required, we can fix them together.
Please do not squash commits even if it is a big change.
I pushed a commit to fix the problems.

title: [rpc][client] Introduce a RpcGatewayCache to accelerate the rpc gateway proxy creation speed.
body:
<!-- Please specify the module before the PR name: [core] ... or [flink] ... -->

### Purpose
Introduce a RpcGatewayCache to accelerate the rpc gateway proxy creation speed.
<!-- Linking this pull request to the issue -->
Linked issue: close #127 

<!-- What is the purpose of the change -->

### Tests
N.A
<!-- List UT and IT cases to verify this change -->

### API and Format
N.A
<!-- Does this change affect API or storage format -->

### Documentation
N.A
<!-- Does this change introduce a new feature -->
author: RocMarshal

comments.body:
Hi @RocMarshal , thanks for the contribution! 

However, the `GatewayClientProxy` is stateless and thread-safe, and is designed can be shared across different places. So we don't need to introduce a map cache for it.

Besides, the `GatewayClientProxy` holds a `ServerNode` supplier, because the bucket leader server may change, and the supplier makes `GatewayClientProxy` resilient to changes in the cluster topology by dynamically providing the updated ServerNode instance. This ensures that the `GatewayClientProxy` always interacts with the current leader server for the bucket, thereby maintaining consistent and efficient communication even if the leadership or server configuration shifts. However, the caching mechanism forces `GatewayClientProxy` to bind a static `ServerNode`. So caching breaks resilience to changes in the cluster topology.

We do need some improvement around `GatewayClientProxy` to reduce the re-creation. But we need some design first.

Thanks @wuchong for the check and clarification.
This makes sense to me. If possible, could this task be assigned to other developers?  and I'm  happy to do some review work about the issue.
@RocMarshal sure, I will close this pull request, and let's move discussion to the issue.

title: Change Dockerfile linux version which contains apt-get.
body:
Current docker image is from `openjdk:17-alpine`,  which is alpine linux. However, alpine linux lacks of apt-get, thus ` apt-get update; apt-get -y install gpg libsnappy1v5 gettext-base libjemalloc-dev; ` will throw exception.

This PR change linux image as `eclipse-temurin:17-jre-jammy `
author: loserwang1024

comments.body: LGTM +1, cc @wuchong

title: LazyMemorySegmentPool use BlockingQueue instead of using list with lock
body: Currently, in `LazyMemorySegmentPool`, we use a List with a lock to manage cachePages. This approach requires the use of locks and manual writing await logic, which is not as efficient as using a `BlockingQueue`.  Moreover, replacing it with a `BlockingQueue` would not introduce any potential correctness issues.
author: swuferhong

comments.body: I would like to do it.pls assign to me

title: Unified WriterMomeryBuffer With MemorySegmentPool
body: Currently, we use both `WriterMomeryBuffer` and `MemorySegmentPool` in Fluss client to control the total memory size when the client writes data. For columnar RowData, we use `MemorySegmentPool`, and for row-based RowData, we use `MemorySegmentPool`. However, there is no fundamental difference between these two. We hope to unify these two data structures into WriterMemoryBuffer in the future.
author: swuferhong

comments.body: This has been addressed by d0b466fb4051375f758059acf9bb956f28fa007c
